page.title: 09Shopping in Canterbury
page.content:
As Canterbury was extensively bombed during World War II much{rebuilding } has gone on during the past 30 years.
The City centre has changed from a wide variety of small locally owned shops to there now being many large {chain stores.}Provision{shops}have moved to the outskirts, providing large{car parks}for customers use.
Canterbury is considered the shopping centre of East Kent - the majority of people being satisfied with the selection of shops, especially as The Marlowe Arcade was opened in Spring 1985, but car parking is a problem, especially at week-ends.
